original: Āryaśrī grahamātṛkā nāma dhāraṇī omnamo bhagavate āryya graha mātṛkāyai om namo sarvabuddha bodhisatbebhya eva mayā śruta mekasmin samaye
analyzed: ārya śrī graha mātṛkā nāma dhāraṇī om namaḥ bhagavate āryya graha mātṛkāyai om namaḥ sarva buddha bodhisatbebhyaḥ eva mayā śruta m ekasmin samaye
translated: The Noble Dhāraṇī Called the Mother of All Planets Oṃ. Homage to the Blessed Noble Mother of All Planets. Oṃ. Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas. Thus have I heard at one time

analyzed: ḍakavatyāḥ mahā nagaryyāḥ deba
translated: In the great city of Dakṣiṇāvatī, by many gods,

analyzed: nāga
translated: Nāgas,

analyzed: yakṣa gandharbā
translated: Yakṣas, Gandharvas,

original: sura / garuḍa / kinnara /🔽mahoragāpsarādibhirāditya / somā gāra budha bṛhaspati śukra / śaniścara /
analyzed: sura garuḍa kinnara  mahoraga apsara ādibhiḥ āditya soma āgāra budha bṛhaspati śukra śaniścara
translated: Suras, Garuḍas, Kinnaras,🔽Mahoragas, celestial nymphs, and so forth, by the Sun, Moon, Mars, Mercury, Jupiter, Venus, Saturn,

original: rāhu ketubhiraṣṭāvi śati nakṣatrādibhistūyamāno mahāvajra samayā lakāra byūhonāmabyu tthāyā dhisthānādhiṣṭite sihāsane biharatisma //
analyzed: nakṣatra ādibhiḥ tūyamānaḥ mahā vajra
translated: Rahu, Ketu, and the twenty-eight lunar mansions, and so forth. He was praised. He was dwelling on the lion throne, which was blessed by the place of blessings, in the array called the Great Vajra Samaya La.

analyzed: anekaiḥ bodhisatva śata sahasraiḥ
translated: Together with many hundreds of thousands of Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tat yathā
translated: Namely:

original: bajrapāṇināca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //🔽bajrasenenaca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //🔽bajrabināyakenaca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //
analyzed: bajrapāṇinā ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena  bajrasenena ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena  bajrabināyakena ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi,🔽The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Vajrasena,🔽The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Vajravināyaka,

analyzed: tena ca nāma bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva named Vajravikurvita,

original: bajracāpa hasṭenaca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //🔽bajrādhipenaca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //
analyzed: bajracāpa hasṭena ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena  bajrādhipena ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: Vajra-bow-wielding Bodhisattva Mahasattva,

original: bajrālakāre ṇaca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //🔽bajnabikrame naca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //🔽jyoti bajreṇaca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //
analyzed: bajra alakāre ṇa ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena  bajna bikrame na ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena  bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: Vajra-lord Bodhisattva Mahasattva,🔽Vajra-ornament Bodhisattva Mahasattva,🔽Vajra-heroic stride Bodhisattva Mahasattva,

analyzed: avalokiteśvare ṇa ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: Jyoti-vajra Bodhisattva Mahasattva,🔽Avalokitesvara Bodhisattva Mahasattva,

analyzed: bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: Worldly glory Bodhisattva Mahasattva,

original: padmaketu nāca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena ratnaketunāca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //
analyzed: padmaketu nāca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena ratnaketunā ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: Lotus-banner Bodhisattva Mahasattva, Jewel-banner Bodhisattva Mahasattva,

original: bikaśita baktrenaca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //🔽mañjuśriyāṇaca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena //
analyzed: vikaśita baktrena ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena  mañjuśriyāṇa ca bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: Smiling-faced Bodhisattva Mahasattva,🔽Manjusri Bodhisattva Mahasattva,

analyzed: maitreyena ṇa ca nāma bodhisatvena mahāsatvena
translated: Maitreya Bodhisattva Mahasattva,

original: evapramukhai mahābodhisatba śatasahasrai sārddha parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto bhagabān dharma paryyāya deśa yamtisma //
analyzed: evapramukhaiḥ mahā bodhisatba śata sahasraiḥ sārddha parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ bhagabān dharma paryyāya deśa yamtisma
translated: Surrounded and revered by these and other great bodhisattvas, the Blessed One taught the Dharma discourse.

original: ādaukalyāṇa madhyekalyāṇa paryya basāne kalyāṇa svarthasuvyañjana kebala paripūrṇa pariśuddha paryyabadāta brahmacaryya saprakāśayatisma
analyzed: ādau kalyāṇa madhye kalyāṇa pari kalyāṇa su artha su vyañjana kebala paripūrṇa pariśuddha paryyabadāta brahmacaryya sa prakāśayati sma
translated: In the beginning, middle, and end, it is good, with good meaning and good phrasing, complete, pure, and clean, and he taught the holy life.

original: atha khalu punarbajrapāṇi bodhisatva staparṣatmaṇḍala mavalokyā sanādutthāya ṛddhyadhiṣṭhānāyā neka bhagavanta makane śatasahasra pradakṣiṇī
analyzed: atha khalu punar bajrapāṇi bodhisatvaḥ sta parṣad maṇḍalam avalokya ā sanāt utthāya ṛddhi adhiṣṭhānāyāḥ śata sahasra pradakṣiṇī
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Vajrapani, looking at the assembly of sages, rose up and, through his supernormal powers, circumambulated the Blessed One hundreds of thousands of times,

original: kṛtya praṇamya puratoniṣadya ratnagarbheṇa paryeka mābhuhya līlayāstatparṣa nmaṇḍala mavalokya bajrājali svahṛdaye pratiṣṭhāppa bhagavanta 🔽bhetadavocat //
analyzed: praṇamya puratas niṣadya ratnagarbheṇa paryekam ābhuhya līlayā asta parṣad maṇḍala mavalokya sva hṛdaye pratiṣṭhāppa bhagavanta  bhā etat avocat
translated: bowed down, sat in front, was embraced by Ratnagarbha, and with a playful glance at the assembly, placed the vajra garland in his heart and said to the Blessed One:

original: grahāśca bhagavānu grānugrarū pāśca raudrāraudra rūpāśca krūrā krararūpāśca satvāviheṭhayanti //
analyzed: grahāḥ ca raudra a raudra rūpāḥ ca krūra krara rūpāḥ ca
translated: The grahas, Blessed One, the grahas in the form of benefactors, the grahas in the form of tormentors, the grahas in the form of the fierce and terrible, the grahas in the form of the cruel and frightful, harm beings.

analyzed: keṣācid prāṇam apaharanti  keṣācid upa druvāḥ ca kurvanti
translated: Some take away their life.🔽Some cause them to be afflicted with disease.

analyzed: keṣāci dojaḥ hārāḥ ca kurvanti
translated: Some cause them to be robbed.

original: keṣācid dravyamapaharanti keṣācid dīrdhāyūḥ satvānāmalpāyū kurvanti /
analyzed: keṣācid dravyam apaharanti keṣācid dīrdhāyūḥ satvānām alpa āyū kurvanti
translated: Some steal their possessions. Some make long-lived beings short-lived.

analyzed: eva sarva satvām upadra vātaḥ bāhayanti
translated: May all beings be protected from harm.

original: taddeśayatu bhagabān dharmaparyyāya yena sarvasatvānī sarbopadravebhyaḥ rakṣābhaviṣyati /🔽bhagabāhanā /
analyzed: tat deśayatu bhagabān dharmaparyyāya yena sarva satvānī sarva upadravebhyaḥ rakṣā bhaviṣyati  bhaga bāhanā
translated: May the Blessed One teach the Dharma discourse by which all beings will be protected from all harm.🔽The Blessed One said:

original: sādhusādhu bajrapāṇe yastva sarbasatbānāmarthāya hitāya sukhāya kṛpā cinta mutpādya guhyāti guhyatara tathāgata samyaksabuddha paripṛcchasi
analyzed: sādhu sādhu bajrapāṇe yaḥ tva sarva satbānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya kṛpā cinta mutpādya guhya ati guhyatara tathāgata samyaksabuddha paripṛcchasi
translated: Excellent, excellent, O Vajrapāṇi, that you, for the sake of all beings, out of compassion, have generated the thought of benefit, welfare, and happiness, and inquire about the most secret of secrets, the Tathāgata, the Perfectly Awakened One.

analyzed: tat śūṇu sādhuca suṣṭuca
translated: Listen well, then, and pay close attention, I will speak.

original: grahāṇā mugrarūpāṇā kūrātibhīṣaṇa mukhānā mahāguhyoti guhyatara dibyapūjāśca arghaca jāppaca yathānukrama barṇabhedena sarbeṣā yathā
analyzed: grahāṇām mugra rūpāṇām kūra ati bhīṣaṇa mukhānām dibya pūjāḥ ca argha ca jāppa ca yathānukrama barṇa bhedena sarbeṣām yathā
translated: For the fierce-looking grahas with extremely terrifying faces, the great secret, the most secret, divine worship, and the offerings according to the sequence of the distinctions of the syllables, for all of them,

analyzed: tegrāhāḥ pūjitāḥ pratipūjyante nirdahante
translated: those grahas, when worshipped, will be worshipped in return and will burn with the fire of the Yamarī.

analyzed: debatā ca apsarāḥ ca bai kinnarāḥ ca mahā uragāḥ
translated: The gods, the celestial nymphs, the kinnaras, the great serpents,

analyzed: yakṣāḥ ca rākṣasāḥ ca eba mānuṣāḥ ca eba amānuṣāḥ
translated: the yakṣas, the rākṣasas, and both human and non-human beings,

analyzed: krūddhāḥ ca mahā anugraha tejasā
translated: and the wrathful ones, by the great grace and splendor,

analyzed: mantrāḥ ca api yathākrama
translated: I will proclaim their worship and the mantras in sequence.

original: athakhalu bhagabān śākyamunistathāgato rhantyasamyaksabuddhaḥ svahṛdayāt karūṇā bikrīḍitanāma raśmijāla muccāryya grahāṇā mūddhi prabeśayatiśma
analyzed: atha khalu bhagabān śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhanti asamyaksabuddhaḥ sva hṛdayāt karūṇāḥ bikrīḍita nāma raśmi jāla muccāryya grahāṇāḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Shakyamuni, emitted from his heart a web of light rays called Play of Compassion, and entered the heads of the planets.

original: athatatkṣaṇā debate sarbegrahā ādityā dayotthāyā bhagabanta śākyamuni samyaksabuddhena taddeśa yantu bhagabastā dṛśa dharmaparyyāya sāmagrī
analyzed: atha tad kṣaṇāḥ debate sarbe grahāḥ ādityāḥ dayā utthāyāḥ bhagabanta śākyamuni samyaksabuddhena yantu dharmaparyyāya sāmagrī
translated: Then at that moment, all the planets, from the sun and so on, arose and went to the Blessed One, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Shakyamuni, and requested the Blessed One for this Dharma discourse on the collection of mantras.

analyzed: bhūtasya dharma bhānakasya rakṣā kuryāma
translated: We will protect the one who teaches the Dharma.

original: guptiparitrāṇa parigraha paripālana śāntisvastyayana daṇḍa parihāra /🔽śastraparihāra biṣadūṣaṇa /
analyzed: gupti paritrāṇa parigraha paripālana śānti svastyayana daṇḍa parihāra  śastra parihāra biṣa dūṣaṇa
translated: We will provide protection, guard, care, and safety, and avert punishment,🔽avoid weapons, neutralize poison,

analyzed: biṣa nāśana  śīmāvandha
translated: destroy poison,🔽establish boundaries,

analyzed: dharaṇī bandhan ca kuryyāmaḥ
translated: and establish the earth.

original: athakhalu bhagavān śākyamuni stathāgato'rhana samyak sabuddho grahāṇā mantrapūjā bhāṣantesma //
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ samyak sabuddhaḥ grahāṇāḥ mantra pūjāḥ bhāṣante sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened Buddha Shakyamuni, spoke the mantras and offerings for the planets:

analyzed: om megha ulkāya svāhā
translated: Om megholkaya svaha!

analyzed: om śītāśabe svāhā
translated: Om shita-ashva svaha!

analyzed: om raktāga kumārāyasva āha  om budhāya svāhā
translated: Om rakta-agakumara svaha!🔽Om budhaya svaha!

analyzed: om bhoga āspadāya svāhā om asura uttamāya svāhā
translated: Om bhoga-aspadaya svaha, om asura-uttamaya svaha!

analyzed: om kṛṣṇa varṇāya svāhā  om rāhuve svāhā
translated: Om, to the dark-colored one, svāhā!🔽Om, to Rāhu, svāhā!

analyzed: om jyoti ketave svāhā
translated: Om, to the light-bannered one, svāhā!

original: imāni bajrapāṇe navagrahāṇā mantra hṛdayāni paṭhitasiddhāni yathānu krama varṇa bhedena diśāca gandha maṇḍalake cintaye padmamadhye dvādaśāgula
analyzed: imāni bajrapāṇe nava grahāṇā mantra hṛdayāni paṭhita siddhāni yathānu krama varṇa bhedena diśāca gandha maṇḍalake cintaye padma madhye
translated: O Vajrapāṇi, these are the heart mantras of the nine planets, accomplished by recitation, with the distinction of the order of letters. In the incense mandala, visualize a lotus in the middle, twelve finger breadths

original: pramāṇa caturasra caturdbāreṇa śobhita kūṭāgāra cakra samanvita //
analyzed: pramāṇa caturasra caturdbāreṇa śobhita kūṭāgāra cakra samanvita
translated: in size, with a square of four sides, adorned with four doors, and endowed with a wheel-like structure.🔽In the middle of that, on a white lotus, visualize the god Bhāskara, wearing the form of an ascetic, red-colored, with a radiance equal to that of a thousand million suns, with the color of vermilion,

original: tanmadhye sita kamalopari kukuma gandha maṇḍala kecittaye debabhāskara tāpasa rupadhara raktavarṇa sahasra sūryyakoṭī samaprabho sindhūrabarṇa
analyzed: tad madhye sita kamala upari kukuma gandha maṇḍala deva bhāskara tāpasa rupa dhara rakta varṇa sahasra sūrya koṭī sama prabho sindhūra barṇa
translated: with a body adorned with a garland of flames.🔽For this deity, milk and food should be offered.🔽Incense of guggul should be offered.

analyzed: stejaḥ mālina bigraha  asya deya kṣīra bhojana  kundurudhūpa  om megha ulkā ayas bāhā
translated: Om, to Megholikā, svāhā!

original: pūrbasyādiśi raktakamalopari priyagu gandha maṇḍalake somo brāhmaṇa iti jñeyaḥ sitabarṇa jaṭāmakuṭadhara bhuja dbayena akṣasūtra kamaṇaḍalu
analyzed: pūrbasyā diśi rakta kamala upari priyagu gandha maṇḍalake somaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ iti jñeyaḥ sita barṇa jaṭā makuṭa dhara bhuja dbayena akṣasūtra kamaṇaḍalu
translated: In the east, on a red lotus, in the priyagu incense mandala, Soma, known as Brahmā, should be known. He is white-colored, wears matted locks and a crown, holds a rosary and a water pot in his two hands,

analyzed: dhara kumuda
translated: and is adorned with kumuda flowers.

analyzed: dhūpo
translated: For this deity, incense of śrīvās should be offered.

analyzed: bhojana ghṛta odana bā
translated: Food: ghee and rice.

analyzed: omcandrā mṛta bikramāya śītāśavesbāhā
translated: Om. To the one whose valor is like the nectar of the moon, to the swift one, I offer salutations!🔽In the southern direction, on a white lotus, in a sandalwood-scented circle, the ascetic should visualize the red-colored Ratna-crowned Shaktidhara.

original: dakṣiṇasyā diśi śukla kamalopari candana gandha maṇḍalake bhichu magāra cokta raktabarṇa ratna makuṭī śakti dhara //🔽baradahasta /
analyzed: dakṣiṇasyā diśi śukla kamala upari candana gandha maṇḍalake raktabarṇa ratna makuṭī śakti dhara  barada hasta
translated: With a boon-granting hand.🔽Food: fish and meat.

analyzed: bhojana matsya mānsaḥ  bhakta
translated: Food: jaggery and rice.

analyzed: guggu ladhūpa
translated: Incense: guggula.

analyzed: om namaḥ ūrakta aga saḥ ujvala kumārāya svāhā
translated: Om. Salutations to the radiant red Kumara, Svāhā!

original: paścimasyā diśi raktapadmopari kṛṣṇāguru gandhamaṇḍalake brahmacārī budha syāt pītavarṇa raktaśmaśru akṣasūtra kamaṇḍalūdhara //
analyzed: paścimasyāḥ diśi rakta padma upari kṛṣṇa aguru gandha maṇḍalake brahmacārī budha syāt
translated: In the western direction, on a red lotus, in a black aloe-scented circle, the celibate sage should be visualized as yellow-colored, with red beard, holding a rosary and water pot.
Food: fish, mung beans, black gram, and porridge. Incense.

analyzed: gandha rasaḥ
translated: Perfume. Taste.

analyzed: om rāja putra su pīta barṇāya budhāya namaḥ svāhā
translated: Om. Salutations to the prince, the yellow-colored sage Budha, Svāhā!

original: uttarasyādiśi sitakamalopari deva dāru gandhamaṇḍake paribrājako guru ścaiva tapta kāñcana barṇābho raktaśmaśru akṣasūtra kamaṇḍalū dhara
analyzed: uttarasya ādiśi sita kamala upari paribrājakaḥ guru ca eva
translated: In the northern direction, on a white lotus, in a devadāru-scented circle, the wandering ascetic Guru should be visualized as having the color of heated gold, with a red beard, holding a rosary and water pot.

original: asya deya dadhibhaktodana kṣīrabā ghṛtamadhū dhūpa //
analyzed: asya deya dadhi bhakta udana kṣīra bā ghṛta madhū dhūpa
translated: To him, curd, rice, milk, ghee, honey, and incense should be offered.

original: om lohitabarṇa nirgamāya bṛha spataye namaḥ bhogā spadāyasbāhā // //
analyzed: om lohitabarṇa nirgamāya bṛha spataye namaḥ bhogāḥ spadāyasbāhā
translated: Om, salutations to the red-colored one, to the one who goes out, to the one who expands, to the one who is for enjoyment, to the one who is for protection.

original: agneyādiśi raktapadmopari candana gandha maṇḍalake śulka pāśa paraśu brahmacārī gokṣīrabarṇā barāmbho jaṭāmakūṭākṣa kamaṇḍalūdharaḥ //
translated: In the southeast direction, on a red lotus, in a sandalwood-scented circle, with a noose, a goad, and an axe, a celibate, the color of cow's milk, with matted hair and a crown, holding a water pot,

analyzed: asya deya kṣīra bhojana
translated: to him, milk-based food should be offered.

analyzed: karpūradhūpa
translated: Camphor incense.

original: om namaḥ śulkādhipataye asūrottamāya birahe sbāhā // //
analyzed: om namaḥ śulka adhipataye asūra uttamāya virahe sbāhā
translated: Om, salutations to the lord of the noose, to the best of demons, in separation, svaha.

original: naiṛtyādiśi sita kamalopari nīlacandana gandhamaṇḍake śaniścara /
analyzed: naiṛtyā diśi sita kamala upari nīlacandana gandha maṇḍake śaniścara
translated: In the southwest direction, on a white lotus, in a blue sandalwood-scented circle, Saturn,

original: kṛṣṇabarṇa kṣapaṇakojñeyaḥ phaṇāmṛta pītajaṭā makuṭaśmaśruḥ akṣasūtra khikhirikādhara //
translated: should be known as the color of black, with a hood, drinking nectar, with matted hair and a crown, with a beard, holding a rosary and a khakhara.
Food: fish, meat, black gram, and oil cake. Incense.

analyzed: gandha rasa
translated: Perfume. Taste.

original: om śaninī lāmbhosa kṛṣṇāya kṛṣṇavarṇāya kṛṣṇabhuk svāhā // //
analyzed: om śaninī lāmbhosa kṛṣṇāya kṛṣṇa varṇāya kṛṣṇa bhuj svāhā
translated: Om, salutations to the dark one, to the one with dark water, to the dark-colored one, to the one who eats dark food, svaha.

original: vāyubyādiśi raktāmbhopari tagarapādi gandha maṇḍalake kāpāliko rājābartta barṇanibhorddha debaraha bhayānacayūge daṣṭrākarāla bhṛkuṭikṛta
analyzed: rakta ambha upari gandha maṇḍalake kāpālikaḥ rājābartta barṇa nibha ūrddha daṣṭra karāla bhṛkuṭi kṛta
translated: In the northeast, on a red water mandala with a camphor base, the king of Kapalikas, resembling the color of a rajbarika, with a terrible and fearful face, with fangs and a frowning forehead,

original: lalāṭa pañcabarṇa meghamadhyetara bhujābhyā candrasūryya kamalābhi nayasthitaḥ asyadeya māṣābhiṣabhojana //
analyzed: lalāṭa pañca barṇa megha madhyetara bhujābhyā candra sūrya kamala ābhi naya sthitaḥ asya deya māṣa abhiṣa bhojana
translated: with a five-colored rainbow in the middle of the clouds on his forehead, with the moon, sun, and lotus in his eyes, with food of meat and blood,

analyzed: tilakṛsa
translated: with sesame, barley, and black incense.

original: om namo bikaṭa baktāya rudhirāsane rāho bhṛgāñjana nibhāya amṛtapribhāya svāhā // //🔽īśānyādiśi raktaśaro rūho paripṛkkā gandhamaṇḍalake caṇḍāla keto bhavet //
analyzed: om namaḥ bikaṭa baktāya rudhirāsane rāho bhṛga añjana nibhāya amṛta pribhāya svāhā  īśānyā diśi bhavet
translated: Om, salutations to Vikata Bakta, to the one seated on a blood throne, to the one resembling collyrium and antimony, to the one fond of nectar, svaha!🔽In the northeast, on a red water mandala with a paripukkha base, there will be the banner of a Chandala,

original: dhūmrabarṇa kṛtāñjatāñjali nāgākṛtisvapuccha bhṛta asyabhojana dhṛtapūraka sajjarasadhūpa /
analyzed: dhūmra barṇa kṛtāñjatāñjali nāga ākṛti sva puccha bhṛta asya bhojana dhṛta pūraka sajja rasa dhūpa
translated: with a smoky color, with folded palms, with the form of a naga, holding its own tail, with food of a filled stomach, with the essence of black incense.

original: om dhūmrāmma varṇasanibhāya jyoti ketabe svāhā // //
analyzed: om dhūmrāmma varṇa sanibhāya jyotiḥ ketabe svāhā
translated: Om, salutations to the one resembling the color of smoke, to the one with a smoky banner, svaha!

analyzed: maṇḍala pūrva dvāre buddhaḥ bhagavān dakṣiṇa dvāre bajrapāṇiḥ
translated: At the eastern gate of the mandala, there is Lord Buddha. At the southern gate, there is Vajrapani.

analyzed: paścima dvāre lokanātha
translated: At the western gate, there is Lokanatha.

analyzed: uttara dvāre mañjuśrī kumāra pīrvottarakaḥ ṇe
translated: At the northern gate, Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta in the north-east,

analyzed: bhaṭṭārikā mahādeva aśve tāruṇā trimukhā
translated: The Great Goddess Mahādevāśvā, youthful, three-faced,

analyzed: tri netrā
translated: Three-eyed,

original: ṣaṭbhujā hastadvayena vyākhyānamūdrā dakṣiṇa kulīśadharā vāmepadmacāpadharā ratna makūṭi nīlavajraparyyako pariṣṭhā candrā sana samāśritā ṣoḍaśākārā
analyzed: ṣaṣ bhujā hasta dvayena pariṣṭhā candrā sana samāśritā ṣoḍaśa ākārā
translated: Six-armed, in the pair of right hands displaying the gesture of teaching, holding a skull in the right, in the left a lotus bow, wearing a jeweled crown, seated on a blue vajra-throne, supported by a moon seat, with sixteen aspects,

analyzed: sarvā lakāra bhūṣitā
translated: All adorned with the syllable la.

original: maṇḍala pūrvadvāre vāhye dhṛtarāṣṭrasya dadhibhaktaḥ //🔽viruḍhakasya dadhimāṣabhakta //🔽paścime virupākṣasya kṣīrabhakta //
analyzed: maṇḍala pūrva dvāre vāhye dhṛtarāṣṭrasya dadhi bhaktaḥ  viruḍhakasya  paścime
translated: Outside the eastern gate of the maṇḍala, curd-rice for Dhṛtarāṣṭra,🔽curd and pea-rice for Virūḍhaka,🔽milk-rice for Virūpākṣa in the west,

original: uttara kuberasya dadhimāṣabhakta //🔽sidhūra sameta yathānu kramabarṇa bhedena patākādeyāḥ //
analyzed: uttara kuberasya dadhi māṣa bhakta  yathānu krama barṇa bhedena patākā deyāḥ
translated: curd and pea-rice for Kubera in the north.🔽The banners should be offered according to the sequence of the colors of the respective directions.

analyzed: tathā nukrama barṇa bhedena pūṣpābhiḥ pūjā kartavyā
translated: Likewise, the worship should be performed with flowers according to the sequence of the colors of the directions.

original: pratyeka dīpodeyā ghṛta madhubhyā śakhapūrayitvā pacaratna prakṣipyārdho deyaḥsarbeṣāmūkha pyatodeyamiti //
analyzed: pratyekam ghṛta madhubhyā śakha pūrayitvā paca ratna prakṣipya ardhaḥ deyaḥ sarbeṣām ūkham iti
translated: Each lamp should be filled with ghee and honey, a pearl should be placed in it, and half should be offered. It should be offered to all.

analyzed: bhujāsana
translated: Thus, the colors, arm positions, and mudrā signs are as follows:

original: namaḥ sarbatathāgatebhya / sarbāsā paripūrakebhya / sarbapari pūrṇābhakti /svāhā //
analyzed: namaḥ sarba tathāgatebhya paripūrakebhya
translated: Homage to all the Tathagatas, to all the fulfillers of all wishes, to all the completely fulfilled devotions, svāhā!

analyzed: ratnatrayasya
translated: One should recite the mantra of the Three Jewels.

analyzed: sapta sapta aṣṭa mantra m ekaśas
translated: Seven times each, the mantra eight times.

analyzed: pūjitā sarva grahāḥ vividha rupiṇa
translated: Thus, all the planets are worshipped in various forms.

analyzed: dadāti bipulā bhogā saubhāgya janayanti api
translated: They grant abundant enjoyments and also generate good fortune.

original: imāni bajrapāṇe nabagrahāṇā mantra hṛdayāni paṭhitatiddhāni //
analyzed: imāni bajrapāṇe mantra hṛdayāni
translated: O Vajrapāṇi, these are the heart mantras of the nine planets, which are effective when recited.

original: yathānu kramabarṇabhe dena gandha maṇḍalaka kṛtvā dvādaśāgula pramāṇa maṇḍalamadhye pūjayitavyāni tāmramṛnmaya rupyādi bhājanena arghadatvā
analyzed: yathānu krama barṇa bhedena gandha maṇḍalaka kṛtvā dvādaśa agula pramāṇa maṇḍala madhye pūjayitavyāni tāmra mṛd maya rupya ādi bhājanena
translated: Having made a fragrant circle according to the sequence of the letters, in the center of a circle measuring twelve finger breadths, they should be worshipped in a vessel made of copper, clay, silver, etc., after offering argha.

original: aṣṭottara śatabārā parijappa paścatpuna bajrapāṇe grahamātṛkā nāma dhāraṇī mantrapadāni saptabārānū ścārayitavyāni //
analyzed: aṣṭa uttara śata bārā parijappa paścat puna bajrapāṇe grahamātṛkā nāma dhāraṇī mantra padāni sapta bārā anu ścārayitavyāni
translated: Having recited [the mantras] one hundred and eight times, then, O Vajrapāṇi, the dhāraṇī mantra words named Graha-mātrkā should be recited seven times.

analyzed: tatas te āditya ādayaḥ
translated: Then all those planets, beginning with Āditya, will provide protection, defense, and security.

analyzed: sarbegrahāḥ dāridra mocayiṣyanti
translated: All the planets will liberate from poverty.

analyzed: gata āyuṣaḥ dīrgha āyuṣaḥ bhavati
translated: One with a short lifespan will have a long lifespan.

original: yaścakhalu puna bajrapāṇe bhikṣu bhikṣu ṇyupāsako pāsikāvā anayāsatvajātīyā /
analyzed: yaḥ cakhalu puna bajrapāṇe bhikṣu bhikṣu anayā sattva jātīyā
translated: And, Vajrapani, for those monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen who are not of the nature of sentient beings,

analyzed: patiṣyanti
translated: who will have these (mantras) written on their ear-lobes,

analyzed: mṛtyūn ākāla kariṣyanti
translated: they will not meet with untimely death or misfortune.

original: yaścakhalu vajrapāṇe grahamaṇḍala madhye pujayitvā dinedine bācayiṣyati //
analyzed: yaḥ ca khalu vajrapāṇe graha maṇḍala madhye pujayitvā dine dine bācayiṣyati
translated: And, Vajrapani, for those who, having worshipped in the midst of the circle of planets, will recite (this) daily,

analyzed: tatas tasya dharma bhānakasya sarva grahā
translated: then all the planets of that Dharma preacher,

analyzed: sarvena sarva āśā paripurayiṣyanti
translated: will fulfill all their wishes and desires.

analyzed: tad kulāt api dāridrāḥ nāśayiṣyanti
translated: They will also remove poverty from his family.

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śākyamuniḥ stathāgata
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata Shakyamuni,

analyzed: punar api grahamātṛkā nāma dhāraṇī bhāṣatesma
translated: again spoke the Dharani called Grahamatrika:

analyzed: namaḥ ratnatrayāya  om bajradharāya namaḥ
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels!🔽Om, homage to the bearer of the vajra!

analyzed: om padma dharāya namaḥ
translated: Om, homage to the bearer of the lotus!

analyzed: om kumārāya namaḥ
translated: Om, homage to the youth!

original: omnama sarba grahānā sarbāśā paripurakānī omnamo nakṣatrāṇā //
analyzed: omnama sarba grahānā sarba āśā paripurakānī omnamaḥ nakṣatrāṇā
translated: Om, homage to all the planets, fulfillers of all wishes and desires, Om, homage to the lunar mansions!

analyzed: om namaḥ dvādaśa rāśīnā
translated: Om, homage to the twelve houses!

analyzed: omnama sarva upadravāṇā
translated: Om, homage to all the afflictions!

analyzed: tat yathā
translated: To wit:🔽Om, homage to all the planets, fulfillers of all wishes and desires, Om, homage to the lunar mansions!

original: ombuddhe bajre sara prasara smara krīḍa krīḍaya mara māraya mardaya ghātaya mama sarbasatvānāca sarvabighrān
analyzed: ombuddhe bajre padme sara prasara smara krīḍa krīḍaya mara māraya mardaya ghātaya mama sarva sattvān āca sarva bighrān
translated: Oṃ, to the Buddha Vajra, Sarva, Pra, Sara, Smara, Kīlaya, Kīlaya, Mara, Māraya, Marda, Ghātaya, to me and all beings, all obstacles,

original: chinda bhinda sarbavi ghrānnāśaya kuru mamasaparibārasya sarbasatvānāca kāryya kṣepaya sarvapāpāni mamasaparivārebhyaḥ śānte dānte 🔽dāpaya dutadarśayātmāna bhagavati rakṣa mamasarva satvānāca sarvagraha nakṣatra pīḍānivāraya bhagavatiśreya kuru mahāmāyā prasādhaya 🔽sarbaduṣṭā nāśaya sarvapāpāni mamasaparivārasya candre candrani turu muru mū mūñca bhavābhave ugrāugra tapātape puraya bhagavati 🔽manoratha mamasarva satvānāca sarvanakṣatra graha pīḍā nibāraya sarva tathāgatā dhiṣṭhānādhiṣṭhite samaye svāhā //
analyzed: chinda bhinda kuru kuru mamasa paribārasya kṛru sarva pāpāni mamasa parivārebhyaḥ śānte dānte  dāpaya bhagavati rakṣa sarva graha nakṣatra kuru mahāmāyā prasādhaya  sarva duṣṭāḥ nāśaya sarva pāpāni candre candrani bhava abhave ugra augra tapa ātape bhagavati  manoratha sarva nakṣatra graha pīḍā nibāraya sarva tathāgatāḥ dhiṣṭhāna adhiṣṭhite samaye svāhā
translated: Cut, break, destroy all obstacles, make my retinue and all beings' work successful, remove all my retinue's sins, to me, peaceful, disciplined,🔽Give, show yourself quickly, Blessed One, protect me and all beings, ward off the afflictions of all planets and constellations, Blessed One, bring about what is excellent, accomplish the great illusion,

analyzed: omsbāhā husvāhā 🔽hris bāhā 🔽dhūḥ svāhā 🔽dhīḥ svāhā 🔽om ādityāya sbāhā
translated: Destroy all evil, remove all my retinue's sins, to the moon, to the sun, to the stars, to the planets, to the constellations, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to the planets, to

analyzed: om somāyasbāhā
translated: Om, to Soma, svāhā.

analyzed: om dharaṇīsutāya sbāhā om budhāya svāhā om bṛhaspataye sbāhā om śukrāya sbāhā
translated: Om, to the son of the earth, svāhā. Om, to the ocean, svāhā. Om, to Bṛhaspati, svāhā. Om, to Śukra, svāhā.

analyzed: om śaniścarāya sbāhā
translated: Om, to Śani, svāhā.

analyzed: om rāhu bes bāhā
translated: Om, to Rāhu, svāhā.

analyzed: om keta besbāhā om buddhāyasbāhā  om bajrapāṇaye svāhā
translated: Om, to Ketu, svāhā. Om, to the Buddha, svāhā.🔽Om, to Vajrapāṇi, svāhā.

analyzed: om padma dharāyas bāhā
translated: Om, to the lotus-holder, svāhā.

analyzed: om kumārāya sbāhā
translated: Om, to Kumāra, svāhā.

analyzed: om sarba grahāṇā sbāhā om sarba nakṣatrāṇā sbāhā
translated: Om, to all the planets, svāhā. Om, to all the lunar mansions, svāhā.

original: omsarvopadrabo sarbabidyai sbāhā imāni bajrapāṇe grahamātṛkā nāma dhāraṇī kārtika māse śulka pakṣe saptamī mārabhya poṣadhikobhūtbā
analyzed: om sarvopadrabo sarba bidyai sbāhā imāni bajrapāṇe grahamātṛkā nāma dhāraṇī kārtika māse śulka pakṣe saptamīm ārabhya
translated: Om, to all calamities and all knowledge, svāhā. O Vajrapāṇi, these are the dhāraṇīs called the Graha Mātṛkās. In the month of Kārttika, starting from the seventh day of the bright fortnight, one should be a poṣadhika.

original: yā caturdaśī graha nakṣatra maṇḍala dine saptavārā nuccārayitabyā //
analyzed: yā caturdaśī graha nakṣatra maṇḍala dine sapta vārā nu uccārayitabyā
translated: And on the fourteenth day, the day of the circle of planets and lunar mansions, one should recite the seven-day mantra.

original: tataḥ pūrṇamāsyā mahorātra pūjā kṛtbā vācayentasya navanavati varṣāṇi mṛtyubhaya nabhavati //
analyzed: tatas pūrṇamāsyāḥ mahorātra pūjā kṛtbā vācayentasya navanavati varṣāṇi
translated: Then, on the full moon day, having made a great all-night pūjā, one should recite it. For ninety-nine years, the fear of death will not arise.

analyzed: ulkā pāta graha pīḍā bhaya na bhaviṣyati
translated: The fear of falling meteors and affliction by planets will not occur.

analyzed: jātaujātau jātismaraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In every birth, one will be one who remembers one's past lives.

original: athate sarve grahāḥ sādhū bhagavanniti praṇabhyāttarhito bhavanniti //
analyzed: atha te sarve grahāḥ sādhū bhagavan iti praṇabhyāt tarhitaḥ bhavan iti
translated: Then all the planets said, Excellent, Blessed One! and remained attentive, bowing down to the Blessed One.

original: idamavocaṭ bhagavān nāntamanā steca bhikṣavaḥ sāca sarbāvatī parṣatsa debamānuṣāḥsura /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān na antamanāḥ ste ca bhikṣavaḥ sā ca sarbāvatī parṣad sa deba mānuṣāḥ sura
translated: The Blessed One said this, and those monks, and the entire assembly with gods, humans, demi-gods,

analyzed: garuḍa
translated: Garuḍas,

analyzed: kinnara
translated: kinnaras,

analyzed: mahā uragāḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhya nandan iti
translated: and great serpents, rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: āryyagrahamātṛkā nāma dhāraṇī samāptam
translated: The Dhāraṇī called Noble Graha-mātṛkā is completed.
